tp:docstring.p: Observers monitor the creation of new channels. This functionality can be used for things like message logging. All observers are notified simultaneously; they should not alter the state of the channel.

Whenever new channels are signalled, the channel dispatcher will notify all running or activatable observers whose ObserverChannelFilter property (possibly as cached in the .client file) indicates that they are interested in the channel.

Observers are activated for all channels in which they have registered an interest - incoming, outgoing or automatically created - although of course the ObserverChannelFilter property can be set to filter on the Channel.FUTURE.Requested property.

A specification of the channels in which this observer is interested. The ObserveChannels method should be called by the channel dispatcher whenever any of the new channels in a NewChannels signal match this description.
Only certain D-Bus types have useful semantics for matching like this, so only certain types are allowed:

dl.dt: Integers of all sizes, including byte (y, n, q, i, u, x, t)
dl.dd: Matched by numeric value, regardless of type (e.g. 42 as a 16-bit signed integer 'n' is considered equal to 42 as a 32-bit unsigned integer 'u')
Matched by equality in the obvious way; not considered equal to any other type
Matched by equality in the obvious way; not considered equal to any other type
Matched by equality in the obvious way; not considered equal to any other type

tp:docstring.p: This property never changes while the observer process is running. For activatable processes, the filter can change due to an upgrade - the channel dispatcher SHOULD observe changes to .client files using a mechanism like inotify.

For observers that have a .client file, the channel dispatcher may discover this property from keys of the form ObserverChannelFilter index propertyname type in the group in the .client file whose name is the name of this interface.
Integers in the .client file are encoded in ASCII decimal, booleans are encoded as "true" or "false", and strings are encoded in the usual way for desktop files.
For instance, a .client file for an observer that is only interested in Text channels, with CONTACT or ROOM handles, that were requested by a local client:
tp:docstring.pre:
[org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Client.DRAFT] Interfaces=org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Client.Observer.DRAFT;
[org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Client.Observer.DRAFT] ObserverChannelFilter 0 org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type s=org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type.Text ObserverChannelFilter 0 org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.TargetHandleType u=1 ObserverChannelFilter 0 org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.FUTURE.Requested b=true ObserverChannelFilter 1 org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type s=org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type.Text ObserverChannelFilter 1 org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.TargetHandleType u=2 ObserverChannelFilter 1 org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.FUTURE.Requested b=true

tp:docstring.p: Called by the channel dispatcher when channels in which the observer has registered an interest are created.
The observer MUST NOT return from this method call until it is ready for a handler for the channel to run (which may change the channel's state).

tp:rationale.p: The channel dispatcher must wait for observers to start up, to avoid the following race: text channel logger (observer) gets ObserveChannel, text channel handler gets HandleChannels channel handler starts up faster and acknowledges messages, logger never sees those messages.

arg.name: Connection
arg.tp:docstring: The Connection with which the channels are associated. The well-known bus name to use can be derived from this object path by removing the leading '/' and replacing all subsequent '/' by '.'.

tp:docstring.p: The Channels and their properties. Their well-known bus names are all the same as that of the Connection.

tp:rationale.p: The ChannelDispatchOperation is not supplied: for requests, there isn't one, and for incoming channels, it hasn't been created yet.

tp:docstring.p: Other information about these channels, in an as-yet unspecified format.

tp:rationale.p: The idea is that this will include the object path of the Account, if available, and anything else we think of later.
